featured.text: The term “hula,” however, did not enter the English language until the 1700s, when British sailors first witnessed hula dancing in the Hawaiian Islands.
It was carried on sailing ships around the world because it was found to help prevent scurvy, a disease that often 25 sailors on long voyages.

definition.zh_def: 水手；在船上工作的人，負責航行和操作船隻。
definition.en_def: A person who works on a ship, responsible for navigating and operating the vessel.
definition.example: The sailor skillfully navigated the ship through the storm.
